intro: Oxymeris secunda, commonly known as the African olive, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and elliptical, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers followed by orange-red, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses. Oxymeris secunda thrives in well-drained soils and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
